result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole A Mortenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 11 days granted.  Jail time may be served in Kenosha County

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole A Mortenson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicole A Mortenson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 90 days jail - straight time.  Credit for 11 days.  Jail time may be served in Kenosha County.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicole A Mortenson in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica for Katie Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Masnica requests bail be modified.  State objects. Court denies the request to modify bail.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicole A Mortenson in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Defendant is on a probation hold.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
